intro: Vitex minahassae, commonly known as the Minahassa chaste tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Indonesia. It belongs to the verbena family (Verbenaceae) and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, arranged in clusters. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates. Vitex minahassae is also used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
